text:
Has any one else problems wit update pages via api?

Code (python):
```     page_update_data["name"] = webpage_name
        page_update_data['layout_sections']['dnd_area']['rows'][0]["0"]['params']['content'] =  new_page_content
webpage_url = "<http://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/pages/>"+ webpage_id
        
        print(page_update_data)
        
        headers = {
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
            "Authorization": f"Bearer {bearer_token}"
        }
        # Send a PUT request to update the webpage
        page_update_data = json.dumps(page_update_data)
        response_update = requests.put( webpage_url,data=page_update_data, headers=headers )
        json_data_specific_webpage_update = response_update.json()
        print(json_data_specific_webpage_update)```
I got error: 'message': 'JSON request body is required.'

Thanks for your reply !!!!!! :slightly_smiling_face:
There’s a lot of them actually.. I’ll make a test ! Thanks for your help :mechanical_arm:

We try to resubscribe users via the API, based on this documentation
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing-api/subscriptions-preferences>

The request we made is ( similarly to the example )
POST*`/communication-preferences/v3/subscribe`*

When we do the request, we response is:
"Subscription XXXX for YYYY cannot be updated because they have unsubscribed"

`Is there any settings we could apply on HubSpot side to enable the re-subscription?`

:wave: Hello, team!
I need to create batch association between single contact and multiple companies within single API request
There is a batch create endpoint - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

I noticed that there is no way to use developer api key for creating custom actions using the python SDK. I am not able to figure out how I should pass developer_hapikey. When I use HubSpot.Client.create(api_key=hdhd), even though the auth setting is set to developer_hapikey - it fails to use an api key.

Has anyone figured out a way to create a custom action using HubSpot python sdk?

Hey Everybody!
We have a chatbot communicating with users (via ChatFlow), at a certain point, I would like to _*assign the thread to a user or team* (assignedTo parameter)._ Is this possible via the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations|Conversations inbox and messages API> or any other API? The 'update a thread' endpoint seems like where one would do it, however, the docs state one can only OPEN or CLOSE a thread using that endpoint. Are there any other ways to assign a thread to a user or team programatically?
did you end up needing a public app <@U04T4PT6ZC5>?
Yep currently that's the only way

[Uninstall app marketplace API] - Hey everyone, I made an integration with HubSpot and everything is done, API, CRM cards, Settings page. But I want to clean the database when someone uninstall on the settings -> integrations -> connected apps. Does HubSpot have a API/ webhook that can let us know when someone unistall? Thanks :relaxed:

Hey everyone - <http://drafter.ai|Drafter AI> is making a new tool (that already works, but we're cleaning and refining it) which generates perfect custom code actions for HubSpot (e.g. workflows) based on natural language (e.g. "make a code that takes a contact and does xyz"). I'm manually processing a few hundred pages of documentation pulled from the api documentation webpages. Does anyone have a clean download of the entire API and CMS documentation that could save me a few hundred hours of time?

:bulb: *Feel free to @ anyone at HubSpot who might be able to help!* :bulb:

• The first tool generates custom code actions from natural language
• The second debugs custom code actions for a given code and execution log
• The third (in progress) will convert custom code actions into custom workflow actions ready to put on the marketplace
CUSTOM CODE ACTION AND CUSTOM WORKFLOW ACTION EXAMPLES ARE ALSO VERY HELPFUL
